subject: AI
title: The ReAct Pattern
description: Reasoning and Acting interleaved for step-by-step execution.

hook.text: Thought: I need to find the latest sales numbers. Action: search_database('sales', 'Q3 2024'). Observation: Revenue was $2.3M. Thought: Now I need to compare with Q2...

buildup.text: ReAct (Reasoning + Acting) alternates: the model reasons about what to do (Thought), takes an action (Action), reads the result (Observation), then reasons again. This is the standard agent pattern.

discovery.text: The explicit 'Thought' step forces the model to reason before acting, reducing impulsive tool calls. Without it, models sometimes call tools blindly without considering whether it's the right next step.

twist.text: ReAct can get stuck in loops â€” the model repeats the same thought-action-observation cycle without making progress. Set a max iteration count and add 'if you're not making progress, summarize what you've tried and stop.'

climax.text: ReAct is the most widely used agent pattern. It works well for tasks that unfold one step at a time and where each step informs the next.

punchline.text: Think, act, observe, repeat. The most popular agent pattern for a reason â€” it works.
